callForPapers:
# ICMI 2025: Call for Papers

The **27th ACM International Conference on Multimodal Interaction (ICMI 2025)** is set to take place in **Canberra, Australia**, from **October 13-17, 2025**. This year's conference theme is "**Safe and responsible multimodal interactions**".

## About ICMI

ICMI is the premier international forum uniting research in multimodal artificial intelligence (AI) and social interaction. The conference explores technical challenges in multimodal AI, including machine learning, computational modeling, representations, fusion, data, and systems. It also delves into the study of social interactions, encompassing both human-human and human-computer interactions. ICMI is distinguished by its multidisciplinary nature, valuing scientific discoveries and technical modeling achievements equally, with a focus on impactful applications for the betterment of people and society.

## Submission Types and Topics

ICMI 2025 aims to showcase novel input and output modalities and interactions to its community. The conference will feature:

*   Keynote speakers
*   Technical full and short papers (with oral and poster presentations)
*   Demonstrations and Exhibits
*   Doctoral spotlight papers
*   Late-breaking papers
*   Workshops
*   Grand Challenges

The conference covers a wide range of topics within multimodal AI and social interaction, including but not limited to machine learning, computational modeling, representations, fusion, data, systems, human-human interactions, and human-computer interactions.

## Publication

The proceedings of all ICMI 2025 papers, including Long and Short Papers, will be published by ACM in their International Conference Proceedings and Digital Library. Adjunct proceedings will feature the workshop papers.

## Important Dates & News

*   **[23/12/2024]** Call for Papers and Important dates posted.
*   **[02/04/2025]** Paper submission is open.
*   **[17/04/2025]** Abstract and paper submission deadlines have been extended.

*Please refer to the official conference website for the most up-to-date and detailed deadlines.*

## Co-location with ACII 2025

ICMI 2025 is conveniently co-located with the **13th International Conference on Affective Computing and Intelligent Interaction (ACII 2025)**, taking place from October 8-11, 2025, at the same venue. The organizing committees are working on registration options to facilitate attendance at both conferences.

callForPapers:
# ICINCO 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Informatics in Control, Automation and Robotics (ICINCO) will be held from **October 20-22, 2025**, at the **Barceló Marbella hotel** in **Marbella, Spain**.

ICINCO is sponsored by INSTICC and is held in conjunction with WEBIST 2025, icSPORTS 2025, CHIRA 2025, IJCCI 2025, IC3K 2025, and CoopIS 2025. Registration to ICINCO allows free access to these co-located conferences.

Although the conference is primarily in-person, speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Scope

The purpose of ICINCO is to bring together researchers, engineers, and practitioners interested in the application of informatics to Control, Automation, and Robotics. Four simultaneous tracks will cover Intelligent Control Systems, Optimization, Robotics, Automation, Signal Processing, Sensors, Systems Modelling and Control, and Industrial Informatics.

Authors should highlight the benefits of Information Technology (IT) in these areas. Papers describing original work, advanced prototypes, systems, tools, techniques, and survey papers are welcome. Accepted papers, presented at the conference by one of the authors, will be published in the Proceedings of ICINCO with an ISBN and will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.

Both full research reports and work-in-progress reports are welcome, with oral and poster sessions.

## Conference Areas

1.  **INTELLIGENT CONTROL SYSTEMS AND OPTIMIZATION**
    *   Data Centric Modeling & Control
    *   Decision Support Systems
    *   Distributed Control Systems
    *   Engineering Applications on Intelligent Control Systems and Optimization
    *   Evolutionary Computation and Control
    *   Genetic Algorithms
    *   Hybrid Systems
    *   Intelligent Fault Detection, Diagnosis and Prognostics
    *   Knowledge-Based Systems Applications
    *   Mechatronics Systems
    *   Machine Learning in Control Applications
    *   Networked Control
    *   Neural Networks Based Control Systems
    *   Optimization Algorithms
    *   Planning and Scheduling
    *   Soft Computing and Fuzzy Control
    *   Software Agents for Intelligent Control Systems

2.  **ROBOTICS AND AUTOMATION**
    *   Intelligent and Autonomous Agents
    *   Cognitive Approach for Robotics
    *   Multirobot Systems
    *   Control and Supervision Systems
    *   Engineering Applications on Robotics and Automation
    *   Guidance, Localization, Navigation and Control
    *   Human-Machine Interfaces
    *   Humanoid and Household Robots
    *   Human-Robots Interfaces
    *   Image Processing
    *   Intelligent Transportation Technologies and Systems
    *   Mobile and Flying Robots
    *   Modelling, Simulation and Architecture
    *   Perception and Awareness
    *   Robot Design, Development and Control
    *   Soft Robotics
    *   Robots for Exploration, Surveillance, and Diagnosis
    *   Task and Motion Planning
    *   Telerobotics and Teleoperation
    *   Vehicle Control Applications
    *   Virtual Environment, Virtual and Augmented Reality
    *   Vision, Recognition and Reconstruction
    *   Wearable Robotics for Assistance and Rehabilitation
    *   Robots in the Internet of Things

3.  **SIGNAL PROCESSING, SENSORS, SYSTEMS MODELLING AND CONTROL**
    *   Adaptive Signal Processing and Control
    *   Defect and Change Detection and Identification
    *   Engineering Applications
    *   Information-Based Models for Control
    *   Intelligent Components for Control
    *   Mechanical, Force and Tactile Sensors
    *   Modelling, Analysis and Control of Discrete-Event Systems
    *   Modelling, Analysis and Control of Hybrid Dynamical Systems
    *   Nonlinear Signals and Systems
    *   Optimization Problems in Signal Processing
    *   Processing Biological Signals
    *   Real Time Control Systems
    *   Sensors Fusion
    *   Signal Estimation & Detection
    *   System Identification
    *   System Modelling
    *   Time-Frequency Analysis

4.  **INDUSTRIAL INFORMATICS**
    *   Digital Twins
    *   Energy Efficiency and Green Manufacturing
    *   Human Factors & Human-System Interface
    *   Industrial Networks, Automation and Robotics
    *   Industrial Internet of Things and Sensor Networks
    *   Intelligent Design and Manufacturing
    *   Manufacturing Systems Engineering
    *   Performance Evaluation and Optimization
    *   Precision Engineering
    *   Production Planning, Management and Control
    *   Quality Control and Management
    *   Resources and Knowledge Management in Industry
    *   Supply Chain and Logistics Engineering
    *   Systems Modelling and Simulation

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Robert Babuska**, Delft University of Technology, Netherlands
*   **Uzay Kaymak**, Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands
*   **Michael Berthold**, University of Konstanz / KNIME AG, Germany

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** (Regular Paper or Position Paper) or an **abstract**.

*   **Complete Papers:** Represent completed and validated research (Regular Paper) or a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion (Position Paper).
*   **Abstracts:** Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

**Submission Requirements:**

*   Papers must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   **Double-blind review:** Submissions must be anonymized, without any reference to authors, personal details, or acknowledgments that could disclose identity.
*   **Originality:** Only original papers should be submitted. Plagiarism and self-plagiarism are strictly prohibited and will result in rejection without review.
*   **Submission Platform:** All papers must be submitted through the online platform PRIMORIS.
*   Authors must adhere to the provided Guidelines and Templates.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings with an ISBN, on paper and digital support.
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef, and each paper will be given a DOI.
*   Proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   A short list of presented papers will be selected for revised and extended versions to be published by Springer in an LNEE Series book.

## Important Dates

All dates refer to **AOE time (Anywhere on Earth)**.

*   **Regular Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: **June 6, 2025** (expired)

    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **July 31, 2025**

*   **Position Papers / Regular Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 3, 2025** (expired)
    *   Authors Notification: **July 31, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 5, 2025**

*   **Late-Breaking:**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 24, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **September 3, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 11, 2025**

*   **Workshops:**
    *   Workshop Proposal: **May 27, 2025** (expired)

*   **Special Sessions:**
    *   Special Session Proposal: **May 27, 2025** (expired)
    *   Paper Submission: **July 31, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **September 8, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 17, 2025**

*   **Tutorials:**
    *   Tutorial Proposal: **September 11, 2025**

*   **Demos:**
    *   Demo Proposal: **September 11, 2025**

*   **Panels:**
    *   Panel Proposal: **September 11, 2025**

*   **Abstracts Track:**
    *   Abstract Submission: **July 31, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **September 8, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 17, 2025**

## Special Sessions

*   **COBOTA:** Bridging the Gap in COllaborative roBOtics: from Theory to real Applications
    *   Chairs: Juan Corrales, Pedro Dinis Gaspar and Chedli Bouzgarrou
    *   Submission: **July 31, 2025**

*   **TISAS:** Trustworthy and Intelligent Smart Agriculture Systems: AI, Blockchain, and IoT Convergence
    *   Chairs: Raoudha Ben Djemaa and Hajer Nabli
    *   Submission: **July 31, 2025**

## Tutorials

*   **Path Planning, and Optimization of Idustrial Robots within Gazebo, and ROS Environment**
    *   Instructor: Mojtaba Ahmadieh Khanesar

## Secretariat

*   **ICINCO Secretariat**
*   Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
*   Tel.: +351 265 520 185
*   Fax: +351 265 520 186

*   Web: [https://icinco.scitevents.org](https://icinco.scitevents.org)

## Venue

The conference will take place at the **Barceló Marbella hotel** in Marbella, Spain.

callForPapers:
# MPLR 2025: Call for Papers

The 22nd International Conference on Managed Programming Languages & Runtimes (MPLR, formerly ManLang, originally PPPJ) is a premier forum for presenting and discussing novel results in all aspects of managed programming languages and runtime systems. MPLR 2025 is co-located with ICFP/SPLASH 2025 and will be held from **October 12 to October 18, 2025, in Singapore**.

## Topics of Interest

The areas of interest include but are not limited to:

### Languages and Compilers

*   Managed languages (e.g., Java, Scala, JavaScript, Python, Ruby, C#, F#, Clojure, Groovy, Kotlin, R, Smalltalk, Racket, Rust, Go, Lua, MATLAB, Raku, Pony, …)
*   Domain-specific languages
*   Language design
*   Compilers and interpreters
*   Type systems and program logics
*   Language interoperability
*   Parallelism, distribution, and concurrency

### Virtual Machines

*   Portable intermediate representations (e.g., JVM, WebAssembly, RPython, …)
*   Managed runtime systems (e.g., GraalVM, Android Runtime (ART), V8, JavaScriptCore, .NET, …)
*   VM design and optimization
*   VMs for mobile and embedded devices
*   VMs for real-time applications
*   Memory management and garbage collection
*   Hardware/software co-design
*   Persistence

### Techniques, Tools, and Applications

*   Static and dynamic program analysis
*   Testing and debugging
*   Refactoring
*   Program understanding
*   Program synthesis
*   Security and privacy
*   Performance analysis and monitoring
*   Compiler and program verification and model checking

For questions regarding topics, please contact Program Chair Tomoharu Ugawa at ugawa@ci.i-u.tokyo.ac.jp.

## Submission Categories

MPLR accepts three types of submissions:

1.  **Regular research papers:** Describing novel contributions involving managed language platforms. Papers will be evaluated based on their relevance, novelty, technical rigor, and contribution to the state-of-the-art. (Format: up to **12 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix).
2.  **Work-in-progress research papers:** Describing hot topics or promising new ideas, with perhaps less maturity than full papers. Papers will be evaluated with an emphasis on novelty and the potential of new ideas. (Format: up to **6 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix).
3.  **Industry and tool papers:** Presenting technical challenges and solutions for managed language platforms in the context of deployed applications and systems. Papers will be evaluated on their relevance, usefulness, and results. Suitability for demonstration and availability will also be considered. (Format: up to **6 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix; up to **12 pages** allowed if justified).

Accepted submissions will be published in the ACM Digital Library, unless authors prefer not to be included.

MPLR 2025 submissions must conform to the ACM Policy on Prior Publication and Simultaneous Submissions and to the SIGPLAN Republication Policy. See http://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Policies/Republication

## Author Instructions

*   Submissions need to use the ACM SIGPLAN format with the `sigplan` style.
*   Use the `acmart` document class with the `sigplan` option (not `sigconf`). Refer to `samples/sample-sigplan.tex` for guidance. On Overleaf, change the documentclass option `manuscript` to `sigplan`.
*   For ease of reviewing, please include page numbers in your submission using `\settopmatter{printfolios=true}`.
*   All submissions need to be in **PDF format**.
*   MPLR uses **double-blind reviewing**. Authors should not show their names on a submission and should refer to their own work in the third person. Avoid publicizing the work while it is under review.
*   Ensure legibility when printed on a black and white printer (distinct colors, legible font sizes).

## Submission Site

[https://mplr25.hotcrp.com](https://mplr25.hotcrp.com)

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** June 24, 2025
*   **Paper Author Notification:** July 28, 2025
*   **Camera Ready for Papers:** August 25, 2025
*   **Conference Date:** October 14, 2025

All deadlines are **23:59 AoE (UTC-12h)**.

## Contact

For questions, use the [MPLR contact form](https://conf.researchr.org/contact/icfp-splash-2025/mplr-2025-papers).

callForPapers:
# OOPSLA 2025: Call for Papers

The OOPSLA issue of the Proceedings of the ACM on Programming Languages (PACMPL) welcomes papers focusing on all practical and theoretical investigations of programming systems, languages, and environments. Papers may target any stage of software development, including requirements, modeling, prototyping, design, implementation, generation, analysis, verification, testing, evaluation, maintenance, and reuse of software systems. Contributions may include the development of new tools, techniques, principles, and evaluations.

OOPSLA 2025 will have **two rounds of reviewing**. New papers may be submitted to either round. Papers accepted in either round will be published in the 2025 volume of PACMPL(OOPSLA) and invited to present at the SPLASH conference in 2025.

## What’s New

*   **Reserve Reviewer Policy**
*   **Data-Availability Statement**

## Contact

You can reach the two Review Committee Chairs (Shriram and Sukyoung) through this email: [oopsla-2025-rc-chairs@googlegroups.com](mailto:oopsla-2025-rc-chairs@googlegroups.com). Please allow 1–2 working days for a response, and longer right around deadlines. In your email, please mention the number of the paper you are writing about (if you have one) to facilitate tracking.

## Review Process

PACMPL(OOPSLA) employs two rounds of reviewing. Each paper will typically receive three or more reviews, and authors will have an opportunity to respond to these reviews before decisions are finalized.

At the end of each round, each paper will receive one of the five following decisions:

*   **Accept:** Your paper will appear in the upcoming volume of PACMPL(OOPSLA).
*   **Reject:** Your paper will not appear in the upcoming volume of PACMPL(OOPSLA). A resubmission in less than a year from the original submission is not guaranteed a review if judged substantially similar.
*   **Conditional Accept:** Specific required revisions are needed.
*   **Minor Revision:** Several concerns need to be addressed, potentially requiring specific revisions and broader comments.
*   **Major Revision:** Significant concerns requiring substantial revisions and broader comments, potentially taking longer to execute.

If you receive a Conditional Accept, Minor Revision, or Major Revision decision:

*   There is no restriction on when you can submit your revision.
*   You must submit a clear explanation of how your revision addresses comments, and, if possible, a diff of the PDFs.
*   Submissions will be reviewed by the same reviewers to the extent possible.
*   Unless explicitly withdrawn, your paper is considered under review, and submitting it elsewhere would violate policy.
*   Maintain submission anonymity. If violation is necessary to respond to reviews, discuss with the Chairs first.
*   Conditionally Accepted papers will be invited to submit artifacts for evaluation. Acceptance of artifacts has no impact on paper acceptance.
*   Only **Accepted** and **Conditionally Accepted** papers can submit artifacts for evaluation, as revisions often affect artifacts.

## Reserve Reviewer Policy

To uphold high review standards and manage review loads, for each paper, at least one **senior author** must register as a reserve reviewer on [TPMS](https://www.sigplan.org/Resources/TPMS/), unless exempt.

**Instructions:** Log into TPMS with your HotCRP email. Upload or provide URLs for 5-10 of your previous papers to inform reviewer matching, prioritizing depth, breadth, and rare expertise.

**Definition of Senior Author:** Completed their PhD five or more years ago.

**Exemptions:** A paper is exempt if:

*   It has no senior authors.
*   At least one senior author is already in the RC for this conference.
*   Every senior author satisfies one or more of these criteria:
    *   Is new to SIGPLAN (never published in it before).
    *   Is chairing a SIGPLAN conference with 150+ submissions last year, this year, or next year.
    *   Has other exceptional circumstances preventing reviewing, cleared with RC Chairs at least three days before submission.

One person may serve as a reserve reviewer for multiple papers; enter their information identically for each.

## Submission Guidelines

### Template

Use SPLASH’s PACMPL templates and instructions available on the [SIGPLAN author information page](https://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Author/). Papers should begin with:

```
\documentclass[acmsmall,screen,review]{acmart}
```

### Page Limit

*   **Initial submissions** must be at most **23 pages** using the template. This limit excludes required statements, references, or supplementary material. Papers must be self-contained; reviewers are not obliged to read supplementary material.
*   **Revisions** (including papers from 2024, and final camera-ready papers) can go up to a maximum of **25 pages**. There will be no option to purchase additional pages.

### Anonymity

PACMPL uses **double-blind reviewing**, meaning authors’ identities are only revealed if a paper is accepted. Your papers must:

*   Omit author names and institutions.
*   Use the third person when referencing your own work (e.g., "We extend Smith’s [2004] work on statically typed toads." instead of "We extend our earlier work on statically typed toads [Smith 2004]").
*   Anonymize supplementary material.
*   Suppress acknowledgments entirely until camera-ready.
*   Avoid linking to webpages in your anonymized paper.
*   Disguise or remove document properties (e.g., author name) from PDF files.

> Nothing should be done in the name of anonymity that weakens the submission. When in doubt, contact the Review Committee Chairs.

> If your system is not new and likely known, refer to it as if created by a third party.

> If your submission is based on code in a public repository, cite the code but replace the URL with "link removed for double-blind review". For reviewer access during author response, contact the Review Committee Chairs.

> If submitting an extension of a workshop paper, anonymize references to that work and change the paper title to break a direct link.

### Novelty

Papers must describe unpublished work not currently submitted for publication elsewhere, as per [SIGPLAN’s Re-Publication Policy](https://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Policies/Republication/). Submitters should also be aware of [ACM’s Policy and Procedures on Plagiarism](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/plagiarism-detection-policy) and comply with [ACM’s Policies for Authorship](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/new-acm-policy-on-authorship).

### Data-Availability Statement

Add a section titled **"Data-Availability Statement"** just before references in the initial submission. This will not count towards the page limit but should be limited to at most a few paragraphs (usually one suffices).

In this statement, indicate whether an artifact exists, its nature and limitations, and whether it will be submitted for Artifact Evaluation. This section can include links to preliminary versions of (anonymized) artifacts, datasets, etc., that reviewers *may* find useful (but are not obligated to follow).

> It is understood that some papers have no artifacts; in such cases, explain why. The absence of such an explanation can be cause for rejection.

> Accepted papers that fail to provide an artifact after promising one will be asked to explain the omission.

Artifact Evaluation submission will closely follow paper notification, so review the [Artifact Call](https://2025.splashcon.org/track/splash-2025-oopsla-artifacts) as soon as you submit your paper.

### Procedure

Submit your paper using [HotCRP](https://oopsla2425.hotcrp.com/).

## Publication

PAPMPL is a **Gold Open Access journal**, meaning all papers will be freely available to the public. Authors can voluntarily cover the article processing charge (**USD 400**), but payment is not required.

The official publication date is when the journal is available in the ACM Digital Library. Round 1 accepted papers (OOPSLA1) will be published no earlier than **April 1, 2025**, and Round 2 accepted papers (OOPSLA2) no earlier than **October 1, 2025**. This date affects patent filings related to published work.

## ACM Policies

By submitting, you acknowledge that you and your co-authors are subject to all [ACM Publications Policies](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies), including ACM’s new [Publications Policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/research-involving-human-participants-and-subjects). Alleged violations may lead to paper retraction and other penalties.

Ensure you and your co-authors obtain an [ORCID iD](https://authors.acm.org/author-resources/orcid-faqs) to complete the publishing process, aiding author discoverability and attribution.

The [updated ACM Authorship Policy](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/new-acm-policy-on-authorship) addresses the use of generative AI, clarifies authorship criteria and responsibilities, and defines prohibited behaviors like gift, ghost, or purchased authorship.

## FAQ

### What are reviewers looking for?

Reviewers consider the following criteria:

*   **Novelty:** Presents new ideas and results, properly contextualized within existing research.
*   **Importance:** Contributes to the advancement of knowledge in the field, including work that diverges from dominant trajectories.
*   **Evidence:** Provides sufficient support for claims (e.g., proofs, implemented systems, experimental results, statistical analyses, user studies, case studies, anecdotes).
*   **Clarity:** Contributions, methodology, and results are presented clearly.

### How are papers from previous years handled?

For resubmissions from previous OOPSLA years, the same timeline applies. The organizers attempt to assign the same reviewers and strongly discourage reviewers from issuing another "major revision" decision.

### Are artifacts required?

No. It is understood that some papers have no artifacts. However, if the paper's content and claims suggest an artifact should exist, authors must explain why one will not be provided. Lack of such an explanation can lead to rejection.

### Can a paper be accepted if the artifact is rejected?

Yes. Artifacts may be rejected for reasons unrelated to research results (e.g., packaging issues).

### Am I allowed to post my paper on my web page or arXiv, send it to colleagues, give a talk about it, mention it on social media, …?

The goal is to balance scientific communication with preventing potential reviewers from learning author identities. You may discuss work under submission, but avoid broadly advertising it through media likely to reach your reviewers. When in doubt, contact the Review Committee Chairs for guidance.

**Things you may do:**

*   Put your submission on your home page, arXiv, or other pre-publication sites.
*   Discuss your work with anyone not on the review committees or reviewers with whom you already have a conflict.
*   Present your work at professional meetings, job interviews, etc.
*   Submit work previously discussed at an informal workshop, previously posted on a pre-publication site, or previously submitted to a conference not using double-blind reviewing.

**Things you should not do:**

*   Contact members of the review committee about your work, or deliberately present your work where you expect them to be.
*   Publicize your work on social media in an identifiable way with broad settings (e.g., describing the work or giving its title). A general post about paper submission is acceptable.

> Reviewers will not be asked to recuse themselves unless they feel you have deliberately advertised your authorship information to them.

| **Author Notification (Revision)** | **Tue 18 Feb**      | **Tue 12 August 2025** |
| **Camera Ready**               | **Fri 28 Feb**      | **Fri 22 August 2025** |

callForPapers:
# OSDI '25 Call for Papers

Sponsored by USENIX in cooperation with ACM SIGOPS

The 19th USENIX Symposium on Operating Systems Design and Implementation (OSDI '25) will be co-located with the [2025 USENIX Annual Technical Conference (USENIX ATC '25)](/conference/atc25) and will take place on **July 7–9, 2025**, in **Boston, MA, USA**.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract registrations due:** Tuesday, December 3, 2024, 5:59 pm EST (10:59 pm UTC)
*   **Complete paper submissions due:** Tuesday, December 10, 2024, 5:59 pm EST (10:59 pm UTC)
*   **Author Response Period:**
    *   Reviews available: Thursday, March 6, 2025
    *   Author responses due: Monday, March 10, 2025
*   **Notification to authors:** Tuesday, March 25, 2025
*   **Final papers due:** Thursday, June 5, 2025

[Download Call for Papers PDF](/sites/default/files/osdi25_cfp_111924.pdf)

## Overview

OSDI '25 seeks to present innovative, exciting research in computer systems. It brings together professionals from academic and industrial backgrounds in a premier forum for discussing the design, implementation, and implications of systems software, emphasizing innovative research and quantified or insightful experiences in systems design and implementation.

OSDI takes a broad view of the systems area and solicits contributions from many fields, including operating systems, file and storage systems, distributed systems, cloud computing, mobile systems, secure and reliable systems, systems aspects of big data, embedded systems, virtualization, networking as it relates to operating systems, and management and troubleshooting of complex systems. Work that explores the interface to related areas such as computer architecture, networking, programming languages, analytics, and databases is also welcome. Contributions with highly original ideas, new approaches, and groundbreaking results are encouraged.

## Submitting a Paper

Submissions will be judged on novelty, significance, interest, clarity, relevance, and correctness. Accepted papers will be shepherded through an editorial review process by a member of the program committee.

A good paper will:

*   Motivate a significant problem
*   Propose an interesting and compelling solution
*   Demonstrate the practicality and benefits of the solution
*   Draw appropriate conclusions
*   Clearly describe the paper's contributions
*   Clearly articulate the advances beyond previous work

### Submission Scope and Relevance

The OSDI steering committee, in maintaining a three-decade tradition of a single-track program, is committed to deepening discussions on key computer systems topics. Starting from OSDI '25, there will be a deliberate focus on selecting papers that offer significant contributions to computer systems research and align with community interests. Reviewers will evaluate submissions based on the topic relevance to computer systems and their potential to impact future research and practices in computer systems. Additionally, submissions must demonstrate relevance and offer unique insights to capture the interest of a substantial portion of OSDI attendees. By adhering to these criteria, OSDI aims to continue its legacy by focusing on innovative research that addresses pressing needs in the computer systems field.

## Submission Instructions

*   **Paper Length:** No longer than 12 single-spaced 8.5" x 11" pages, including figures and tables, plus as many pages as needed for references. Use 10-point type on 12-point (single-spaced) leading, two-column format, Times Roman or a similar font, within a text block 7" wide x 9" deep.
*   **Accepted Paper Length:** Accepted papers will be allowed 14 pages in the proceedings, plus references.
*   **Formatting:** Papers not meeting the criteria will be rejected without review. Pages should be numbered, and figures and tables should be legible in black and white, without requiring magnification.
*   **Supplementary Material:** Authors may upload supplementary material in files separate from their submissions. PC members are not required to read supplementary material. Each paper must stand alone without it.
*   **Anonymity:** The paper review process is double-blind. Authors must make a good-faith effort to anonymize their submissions and should not identify themselves or their institutions either explicitly or by implication.
*   **Abstract Registration:** Registering abstracts a week before paper submission is essential for PC members to identify qualified reviewers. Abstracts that do not provide sufficient information will be rejected, precluding paper submission.
*   **Conflicts:** Authors must provide information about conflicts with PC members when registering their abstract.
*   **Simultaneous Submission:** Simultaneous submission of the same work to multiple venues, submission of previously published work, or plagiarism constitutes dishonesty or fraud.
*   **Prior/Concurrent Publication:** Prior or concurrent workshop publication does not preclude publishing a related paper in OSDI. Prior or concurrent publication in non-peer-reviewed contexts, like arXiv.org, is permitted, but your OSDI submission must use an anonymized name for your project or system.
*   **Remote Presentation:** For very special circumstances, USENIX may provide the possibility of remote presentation and Q&A.
*   **Visa Applications:** If you need an invitation letter for a visa, contact conference@usenix.org as soon as possible.

**Submit papers via the [submission system](https://osdi25.usenix.hotcrp.com/).**

## Author Response Period

Authors will have an opportunity to respond to reviews prior to the program committee meeting. Responses must be limited to correcting factual errors or directly addressing reviewer questions.

## Revise and Resubmit

OSDI '25 will continue the option to revise and resubmit for some rejected papers.

# PACBB 2025: Call for Papers

The 19th International Conference on Practical Applications of Computational Biology & Bioinformatics (PACBB'25) will be held at the **University of Lille (France)** from **June 25th to 27th, 2025**.

## About the Conference

The success of Bioinformatics has been driven by research in Molecular Biology and Molecular Medicine, leading to an exponential increase in data. Systems Biology is replacing the reductionist view in biology, requiring interdisciplinary collaboration. The accumulation and exploitation of large-scale databases necessitate new computational technology and research. Computational models and tools used in these initiatives are often based on Computer Science/Artificial Intelligence (CS/AI) techniques, aiding in knowledge discovery, modeling, and optimization.

PACBB'25 aims to promote interaction among the scientific community to discuss applications of CS/AI with an interdisciplinary character, exploring the interactions between sub-areas of CS/AI, Bioinformatics, Chemoinformatics, and Systems Biology.

Brand new ideas, substantial revisions of previously presented work, project summaries, and PhD theses (presented or not) are sought.

## Submission Format

*   All papers must be formatted according to the **LNNS template** (Microsoft Word or LaTeX).
*   Maximum length: **10 pages** (6 pages for Doctoral Consortiums), including figures and references.
*   Papers must be prepared without page numbers.
*   You must upload a ZIP file including:
    *   A signed Copyright Form (**PDF format**).
    *   The final version of your paper (**MS-WORD or LaTeX format**).
    *   A document stating the changes performed taking into account the reviews, using the PACBB conference management system.
*   Please fill out and sign the Consent to Publish.

## Submission System

All proposed papers must be submitted in electronic form (PDF format) using the [PACBB conference management system](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=pacbb25).

## Review Process

All submitted papers will undergo a thorough review process. Each paper will be refereed by at least three experts in the field based on relevance, originality, significance, quality, and clarity.

Papers must consist of original, relevant, and previously unpublished sound research results related to any of the conference topics.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in the PACBB Proceedings, published by **Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems series of Springer Verlag**.

At least one author must register and attend the symposium to present the paper for its inclusion in the proceedings.

**Indexing:** The books of this series are submitted to DBLP, INSPEC, Norwegian Register for Scientific Journals and Series, SCImago, SCOPUS, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, Google Scholar, Springerlink.

## Special Issues

Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended and improved versions to special issues in different journals, including:

*   Journal of Integrative Bioinformatics
*   International Journal of Interactive Multimedia and Artificial Intelligence
*   Logic Journal of the IGPL
*   ADCAIJ
*   MDPI Future Internet Journal (Special Issue: “Deep Learning in Recommender Systems”)
*   MDPI Sensors Journal (Special Issue: "Edge Computing in IoT Networks Based on Artificial Intelligence")
*   MDPI Systems Journal (Special Issue: “Advancements in Practical Applications of Agents, Multi-Agent Systems and Digital Twins”)

## General Deadlines

*   **Submission Deadline:** March 31, 2025
*   **Doctoral Consortium Deadline:** March 31, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** April 25, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Papers:** May 9, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** June 25th-27th, 2025

## Accommodation Grants

CRIStAL Lab offers 15 grants/awards to doctoral and young doctors. More information is available at [/open-calls/call-for-grants-awards](/open-calls/call-for-grants-awards).

## Contact

callForPapers:
# IEEE PacificVis 2026: Call for Papers

IEEE PacificVis 2026 solicits novel research contributions and innovative applications in all areas of visualization. The conference covers topics including visualization techniques and systems, interactions, analytics and decision support, theoretical contributions, empirical studies, and applications in various domains.

The conference will be held in **Sydney, Australia** on **April 20–23, 2026**.

## Submission Tracks

PacificVis accepts a range of scientific contributions, including:

*   **TVCG Journal Papers:** Papers will be published directly in IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (TVCG).
*   **Conference Papers:** Full research papers presented at the conference.
*   **Short Papers (VisNotes):** Shorter contributions for ongoing work.
*   **Posters:** For presenting ongoing research projects or industrial applications.

## Important Dates

All below deadlines are at **11:59pm (23:59) AoE (Anywhere on Earth)**.

*   **Journal track - Abstracts:** September 1, 2025
*   **Journal track - Papers:** September 7, 2025
*   **Journal track - Notification:** October 27, 2025
*   **Conference track - Abstracts:** TBA, 2026
*   **Conference track - Papers:** TBA, 2026
*   **Conference track - Notification:** TBA, 2026
*   **VisNotes - Paper due:** TBA, 2026
*   **VisNotes - Notification:** TBA, 2026
*   **Poster - Summary Submission:** TBA, 2026
*   **Poster - Summary Notification:** TBA, 2026

## Submission Process and Guidelines

*   **Submission System:** IEEE PacificVis uses the [Precision Conference System (PCS)](https://www.precisionconference.com/) for submission and reviewing.
*   **Resubmissions Encouraged:** Authors are encouraged to resubmit revised versions of papers rejected from earlier tracks, with optional reviewer continuity. Past reviews and response letters can be included as supplemental material.
*   **Reviewing Process:** Papers undergo a rigorous, multi-round review process. Some papers may be desk-rejected if out of scope, poorly written, or not following guidelines. Decisions are often conditional acceptances requiring revisions.
*   **Optional Single-Blind:** Authors may choose whether to anonymize their submission. Reviewers' identities are not revealed.
*   **Formatting:**
    *   TVCG journal paper track: TVCG journal format with 9 + 2 pages.
    *   Conference paper track: IEEE VGTC conference format with 9 + 2 pages.
    *   VisNotes paper track: IEEE VGTC conference format with up to 6 pages.
    *   Papers should include full-color figures and a teaser image on the first page.
*   **Originality & Reuse:** All submissions must be original work and not previously published or concurrently submitted. Reuse of verbatim text is prohibited.
*   **Plagiarism Policy:** Plagiarism is unacceptable and will lead to submission removal. All authors must certify originality.
*   **Supplemental Material:** Digital video, code, data, and additional figures are encouraged to enhance review.
*   **Accessibility:** Authors are highly encouraged to make final submissions accessible. Resources are provided for creating accessible PDFs.
*   **Generative AI Policy:** Generative AI tools are permitted for manuscript preparation, but AI cannot be an author. Human authors are responsible for AI-generated content, including plagiarism and falsification. Disclosure of AI use is recommended.
*   **Open Access Policy:** Authors are encouraged to share accepted papers in an open access repository.
*   **Ethics Guidelines:** PacificVis adheres to IEEE VGTC ethics guidelines. Plagiarism and unethical content are taken seriously.

## Paper Topics

See the separate document on [paper topics of interest](href="paper-topics.html").

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE International Conference on Pervasive Computing and Communications (PerCom 2026)

## Conference Details

*   **Conference Name:** IEEE International Conference on Pervasive Computing and Communications (PerCom)
*   **Acronym:** PerCom
*   **Year:** 2026
*   **Edition:** 24th
*   **Location:** National Research Council Area, Pisa, Italy
*   **Dates:** March 16 – 20, 2026
*   **Format:** Physical in-person conference

## Introduction

IEEE PerCom, now in its 24th year, is the premier annual scholarly venue in pervasive computing and communications. Pervasive computing is constantly at the forefront of mobile systems research and has found its way into many commercial systems due to tremendous advances in a broad spectrum of technologies and topics such as wireless networking, mobile and distributed computing, sensor systems, ambient intelligence, and smart devices.

## Scope

PerCom 2026 solicits research contributions in all areas pertinent to pervasive computing and communications, especially those that cross traditional research boundaries. Contributions can be analytical, empirical, technological, methodological, or a combination thereof. Papers reporting strong systems engineering contributions backed by solid and appropriate evaluations are strongly encouraged. Contributions should be **novel** (those presenting only minor improvements over the state of the art will not be considered), should demonstrate a **significant impact** (i.e., they should address an outstanding problem), and should be **rigorous**. The impact of the contributions should be demonstrated in the context of pervasive computing and communications applications.

## Topics of Interest

*   **Advances in pervasive systems and infrastructures:** middleware systems and services; data engineering for pervasive computing; cloud, fog and edge computing; integrations of smartphones in pervasive experiences; applications of device-to-device coordination.
*   **Theories, models, and algorithms:** context modeling & reasoning; adaptive computing; activity & emotion recognition; programming paradigms; applied deep/federated/decentralized machine learning; causal learning; cognitive computing; complex networks; spatio-temporal modeling.
*   **Domain-specific challenges and novel applications:** urban/mobile crowdsensing & intelligence; PerCom for healthcare and well-being; cyber-physical systems; PerCom for space applications, smart homes and virtual assistants; mixed reality; sports analytics; crime prevention; pervasive nowcasting; urban robotics; pervasive AR/VR; smart vehicles; disaster sensing and management.
*   **Intersections of PerCom with:** IoT and sensor systems; Large Language Models; opportunistic networks; pervasive data science; cyber-physical systems; 3D networks.
*   **Enablers for PerCom instrumentation:** security, privacy and trust in Pervasive Computing; ethical aspects of Pervasive Computing.
*   **New techniques for user-level concerns:** participatory and social sensing; fairness and ethics; user interface, interaction, and persuasion; online and offline social networking; human-machine collaboration.
*   **Technological innovations:** architectures, protocols, and technologies for pervasive communications; energy-harvesting, self-powered, or battery-less systems; mobile and wearable systems; smart devices and environments; positioning, navigation, timing, and tracking technologies; device-free human sensing.

## Calls for Participation

*   **Main Conference Paper**
*   **Workshop Proposals**
*   **Demo Papers**
*   **Work-in-Progress (WiP) Papers**
*   **Artifacts**

## Important Dates

### Main Conference Papers

*   **Paper registration in EDAS:** September 12, 2025
*   **Submission via EDAS:** September 19, 2025
*   **1st stage notification:** November 28, 2025
*   **Rebuttal submission:** December 5, 2025
*   **Final notification:** December 22, 2025
*   **Camera Ready:** February 2, 2026

### Call for Work-in-Progress Papers

*   **WiP paper submission:** November 17, 2025
*   **Notification:** January 12, 2026
*   **Camera-ready due:** February 2, 2026

### Call for Demo Papers

*   **Demo paper submission:** December 8, 2025
*   **Notification:** January 8, 2026
*   **Camera-ready due:** February 2, 2026

### Call for Artifacts

*   **Artifact submission deadline:** January 19, 2026
*   **Artifact feedback and revision period:** January 20 – February 6, 2026
*   **Notification (badge allotment):** February 9, 2026
*   **Camera-ready due:** February 16, 2026

### Call for Workshop Proposals [closed]

*   **Workshop proposal submission deadline:** June 16, 2025 (Extended)
*   **Notification:** June 23, 2025 (Extended)

## Submission Instructions

### Submission System

Paper submission must be done for the main conference and all associated events via [EDAS](https://edas.info/). If you do not have an EDAS account, please register first (it’s free).

### Anonymization

PerCom 2026 will follow a **double-blind review process**. Authors are expected to make a good-faith effort to anonymize their submissions. In particular, publishing pre-prints of your submitted papers in online archives (e.g., arXiv) prior to submission does NOT disqualify the paper from consideration at PerCom. Moreover, we instruct reviewers NOT to go searching for pre-prints of submitted papers.

### Format and Length

*   Submitted papers must be unpublished and not considered elsewhere for publication.
*   Only electronic submissions in **PDF format** will be considered.
*   The IEEE LaTeX and Microsoft Word templates, as well as formatting instructions, can be found [here](https://percom.org/submission-instructions/).
*   Papers must be at most **9 pages** of technical content (10pt font, 2-column format), including text, figures, and tables, and up to **1 additional page for references only**.

## Review Process

*   PerCom 2026 introduces a **rebuttal phase**. Authors are offered the opportunity to respond to the initial reviews. Particularly, they are encouraged to briefly clarify points, explain misunderstandings, etc.
*   Submitted papers will undergo a rigorous review process handled by the Technical Program Committee.

## Publication and Awards

*   The best paper will receive the prestigious **Mark Weiser Best Paper Award**.
*   Selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions for a **special issue of the Pervasive and Mobile Computing Journal**.
*   Accepted papers will be published in **IEEE Xplore**.
*   All accepted papers will be invited to submit an artifact abstract providing the code, data, results, etc. associated with the contribution.

## Community Engagement

*   All accepted papers **must be presented** in person by one of the authors, in addition to having an associated full registration.
*   Failure to comply with this requirement will result in the exclusion of the paper from the final proceedings and from the IEEE Digital Library, and the paper will not be eligible for the Best Paper Award.
*   Authors are strongly advised to be prepared to apply for their visa (if required for entry into Italy) as soon as their paper is accepted.
*   Remote presentations and pre-recorded videos are not allowed unless all authors of an accepted paper are under special circumstances that prevent them from attending the conference in person. Requests for such exceptions will be considered carefully by the organizing committees. We are sympathetic to concerns and sentiments about our in-person focus. We will accommodate remote authors/speakers if they have Visa-related travel or COVID/health-related travel issues on case-by-case basis.

## Contact Information

*   **TPC Chairs:** [percom2026-tpc-chairs@fbk.eu](mailto:percom2026-tpc-chairs@fbk.eu)
*   **General Contact:** [ieeepercom@gmail.com](mailto:ieeepercom@gmail.com)

## Sponsorship

*   **Technical Sponsors and Student Participation Grant Sponsors**
*   **Sponsor of the Mark Weiser Best Paper Award:** Elsevier’s Pervasive and Mobile Computing Journal

callForPapers:
# PODS 2026: Call for Research Papers

The annual ACM SIGMOD/PODS Conference is a leading international forum for database researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and results, and to exchange techniques, tools, and experiences. The conference will be held in **Bengaluru, India, on May 31 - June 05, 2026**.

## The Conference

The conference includes a fascinating technical program with research and industrial talks, tutorials, demos, and focused workshops. It also hosts a poster session to learn about innovative technology, an industrial exhibition to meet companies and publishers, and a careers-in-industry panel with representatives from leading companies.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission:** [Link to Important Dates - calls_papers_important_dates.shtml]

## SIGMOD Call for Research Papers

*   [Link to SIGMOD Call for Research Papers - calls_papers_sigmod_research.shtml]

## PODS Call for Research Papers

*   [Link to PODS Call for Research Papers - calls_papers_pods_research.shtml]

## Publication and Open Access

ACM's upcoming transition to Open Access, effective January 1, 2026, means all ACM publications, including those from ACM-sponsored conferences, will be 100% Open Access. Authors will have two primary options for publishing Open Access articles with ACM: the ACM Open institutional model or by paying Article Processing Charges (APCs).

*   **ACM Open Participants:** Most ACM-sponsored conference papers will not require APCs from authors or conferences.
    *   List of participating institutions in ACM Open: [https://libraries.acm.org/acmopen/open-participants](https://libraries.acm.org/acmopen/open-participants)
*   **Non-ACM Open Participants:** Authors from institutions not participating in ACM Open will need to pay an APC, unless they qualify for a waiver.
    *   APC Waivers and Discounts Policy: [https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/policy-on-open-access-apc-waivers-and-discounts](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/policy-on-open-access-apc-waivers-and-discounts)

## Temporary Subsidy for 2026

To ease the transition, ACM has approved a temporary subsidy for 2026:

*   **$250 APC for ACM/SIG members**
*   **$350 for non-members**

This represents a 65% discount, funded directly by ACM. Authors are encouraged to advocate for their institutions to join ACM Open.

## Anti-Harassment Policy

SIGMOD 2026 adheres to the ACM Policy Against Harassment. Any participant who experiences unacceptable behavior may contact any current member of the SIGMOD Executive Committee, the PODS Executive Committee, or DBCares. Concerns will be kept in strict confidence.

## Social Media

Follow us on X to stay updated on what's happening at SIGMOD/PODS 2026.
